Visited Eden on the basis of Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. It's a few blocks from the Verdaguer metro station.  I was the only diner at 19:30 on a January weekday evening. I commenced with an insalata ciociara (9.50€) and Coke Zero (2.00€). The salad was large, fresh, and delicious, composed of Iberian ham, tomatoes, corn, rocket and palm hearts. Next came the spaghetti carbonara (9.50€), al dente with extra parmesan on the side. As I spun the spaghetti on my fork, the steam from the pasta rose in thick clouds from the bowl. It was very good. I closed with a crema catalana (4.50€), a perfect ending to a fulfilling meal.
